```{python}
#| echo: false
import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go

# Load CSV
df = pd.read_csv("data/Bom_En.csv", engine="pyarrow", encoding="utf-8")

# Define page size
page_size = 20  # Adjust rows per page
total_pages = len(df) // page_size + 1

# Create a list of dropdown options
dropdown_options = [
    {"label": f"Page {i+1}", "method": "update", "args": [{"cells": [
        dict(values=[df.iloc[i*page_size:(i+1)*page_size, col].tolist() for col in range(len(df.columns))], align="left")
    ]}]} for i in range(total_pages)
]

# Create the initial table (first page)
fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Table(
    header=dict(values=list(df.columns), fill_color="lightgrey", align="left"),
    cells=dict(values=[df.iloc[:page_size, col].tolist() for col in range(len(df.columns))], align="left")
)])

# Add dropdown for pagination
fig.update_layout(
    updatemenus=[{"buttons": dropdown_options, "direction": "down", "showactive": True}],
    title="Select Page from Dropdown"
)

# Save as HTML
fig.write_html("data/Bom_En_table.html")

```
